Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian society under constant surveillance from an authoritarian government.

Title: A Clockwork Orange
Author: Anthony Burgess
Description: A dystopian novel about the extreme culture of violence and the human desire for free will.

Title: A Passage to India
Author: E.M. Forster
Description: Explores the British colonial presence in India and the deep cultural misunderstandings between the two cultures.

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Author: Charles Dickens
Description: The struggles of the French peasantry, the French Revolution, and love in the time of turmoil.

Title: All the Light We Cannot See
Author: Anthony Doerr
Description: The parallel stories of a blind French girl and a German boy whose paths collide in occupied France during World War II.

Title: Animal Farm
Author: George Orwell
Description: A farm's dystopian society is formed when the animals decide to overthrow the humans.

Title: Anna Karenina
Author: George Orwell
Description: The tragic story of the titular character who is torn between duty and love.

Title: Atlas Shrugged
Author: Ayn Rand
Description: Explores a dystopian United States where leading innovators, ranging from artists to industrialists, refuse to be exploited by society.

Title: Atonement
Author: Ian McEwan
Description: A young girl's mistake changes lives and leads to a personal reflection on guilt and forgiveness during WWII.

Title: Beloved
Author: Toni Morrison
Description: Examines the enduring trauma of slavery and its impact on a family in post-Civil War America.

Title: Bleak House
Author: Charles Dickens
Description: A complex narrative exploring the brutal English legal system.

Title: Blood Meridian
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Description: An epic novel of the violence and depravity that attended America's westward expansion.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley

Title: Catch-22
Author: Joseph Heller
Description: A satirical indictment of military madness and stupidity, and the desire of the ordinary man to survive it.

Title: Cloud Atlas
Author: David Mitchell
Description: A novel consisting of six interconnected stories spanning several centuries and genres.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Title: Don Quixote
Author: Miguel de Cervantes
Description: The story of a delusional Spanish knight who sallies forth to restore chivalry.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Description: The classic tale of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

Title: Dune
Author: Frank Herbert
Description: A complex tale of politics, religion, and power set on the desert planet of Arrakis.

Title: Emma
Author: Jane Austen
Description: The misadventures of matchmaking in a small English town.

Title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Description: A gripping tale of the brutality of the Spanish Civil War.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Description: A gothic tale of a man who creates a monster.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Author: Margaret Mitchell
Description: The survival of a Southern belle through love and war during the American Civil War.

Title: Gravity's Rainbow
Author: Thomas Pynchon
Description: A complex analysis of history and conspiracy during the final months of World War II in Europe.

Title: Gulliver's Travels
Author: Jonathan Swift
Description: A satirical novel about Lemuel Gulliver's voyages to strange and extraordinary lands.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: The beginning of Harry Potter's destiny as a wizard and his battle with Voldemort.

Title: Infinite Jest
Author: David Foster Wallace
Description: A sprawling narrative exploring themes of addiction and recovery, entertainment and consumption.

Title: Invisible Man
Author: Ralph Ellison
Description: A novel that delves into the social and intellectual issues facing African-Americans in the early 20th century.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: A novel following the emotions and experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood.

Title: Les Misérables
Author: Victor Hugo
Description: A novel that examines the nature of law and grace, elaborating upon the history of France, the architecture of Paris.

Title: Light in August
Author: William Faulkner
Description: A complex narrative of racial identity and segregation in the American South.

Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott
Description: The lives and struggles of four sisters growing up during the American Civil War.

Title: Lolita
Author: Vladimir Nabokov
Description: A middle-aged man becomes obsessed with a twelve-year-old girl.

Title: Lord of the Flies
Author: William Golding
Description: A story about a group of boys stranded on an island who turn to savagery.

Title: Madame Bovary
Author: Gustave Flaubert
Description: A profound narrative focusing on the desires and sufferings of Emma Bovary, who seeks escape through forbidden relationships.

Title: Mansfield Park
Author: Jane Austen
Description: The story of Fanny Price, who is raised by her wealthy aunt and uncle, exploring issues of class and morality.

Title: Middlesex
Author: Jeffrey Eugenides
Description: A multigenerational saga exploring gender identity and the American immigrant experience.

Title: Moby Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: The epic quest of Captain Ahab to seek revenge on the white whale that crippled him.

Title: Mrs. Dalloway
Author: Virginia Woolf
Description: Details a day in the life of Clarissa Dalloway as she prepares for a party in post-World War I England.

Title: Native Son
Author: Richard Wright
Description: A powerful novel about the conditions of African Americans in Chicago during the 1930s.

Title: Never Let Me Go
Author: Kazuo Ishiguro

Title: Norwegian Wood
Author: Haruki Murakami

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel García Márquez

Title: Pale Fire
Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Title: Persepolis
Author: Marjane Satrapi
Description: An autobiographical graphic novel about a young girl's experiences growing up during the Islamic Revolution in Iran.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: The turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

Title: Rebecca
Author: Daphne du Maurier
Description: A classic tale of haunting and jealousy from the perspective of a new, young wife.

Title: Robinson Crusoe
Author: Daniel Defoe
Description: A mariner who is shipwrecked on a deserted island and survives there for 28 years.

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Description: A satirical novel about World War II experiences and journeys through time of a soldier named Billy Pilgrim.

Title: Station Eleven
Author: Emily St. John Mandel
Description: A novel about the survival of human culture after a devastating pandemic.

Title: Tess of the d'Urbervilles
Author: Thomas Hardy
Description: A poor woman's struggles against Victorian society's injustices.

Title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Author: Mark Twain
Description: Follows a young boy as he floats down the Mississippi River on a raft with an escaped slave, Jim, encountering various characters and adventures along the way.

Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Description: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the famous detective.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A shepherd's journey to discover a worldly treasure reveals the riches within.

Title: The Bell Jar
Author: Sylvia Plath
Description: A young woman's descent into mental illness and depression in early 1950s America.

Title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
Author: Junot Díaz
Description: A novel detailing the life of a Dominican boy growing up in New Jersey, who is obsessed with science fiction and fantasy novels.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and reason, set against a modernizing Russia.

Title: The Call of the Wild
Author: Jack London
Description: A domesticated dog's journey to survival in the wild Alaskan wilderness.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A teenager's cynical journey through New York City after being expelled from school.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Description: A story of false imprisonment, revenge, and redemption.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A mystery involving a conspiracy within the Catholic Church.

Title: The Divine Comedy
Author: Dante Alighieri
Description: A profound journey through the three realms of the dead: Inferno, Purgatorio, and Paradiso.

Title: The God of Small Things
Author: Arundhati Roy
Description: A family’s history and tragedy in 1960s India.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Author: John Steinbeck
Description: A powerful tale of an Oklahoma family driven off their farm and forced to travel west to the promised lands of California during the Great Depression.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A novel about the American dream and its disintegration during the roaring twenties.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: A future where women are subjugated and controlled in a theocratic society.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: The adventure of Bilbo Baggins as he attempts to secure a treasure protected by a dragon.

Title: The Jungle
Author: Upton Sinclair
Description: A novel that exposes the harsh conditions and exploited lives of immigrants in the United States.

Title: The Kite Runner
Author: Khaled Hosseini
Description: A story of friendship and redemption between two boys growing up in Afghanistan.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: An epic fantasy of the quest to destroy a powerful ring.

Title: The Magic Mountain
Author: Thomas Mann
Description: Set in a Swiss sanatorium, this novel is a deep meditation on illness, wellness, and the creeping malaise of modernity.

Title: The Magic Mountain
Author: Mikhail Bulgakov
Description: A novel where the Devil visits the atheistic Soviet Union, blending elements of fantasy, romance, and political satire.

Title: The Metamorphosis
Author: Franz Kafka
Description: A novella about a man who transforms into a giant insect, exploring themes of alienation and human loneliness.

Title: The Nightingale
Author: Kristin Hannah
Description: Two sisters face brutally different paths through occupied France during World War II.

Title: The Odyssey
Author: Homer
Description: An epic poem recounting the adventures of Odysseus during his journey home from the Trojan War.

Title: The Old Man and the Sea
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Description: The story of an aging Cuban fisherman who struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
Description: A novel that explores themes of aestheticism, moral duplicity, and self-indulgence.

Title: The Plague
Author: Albert Camus
Description: A novel about the human condition and resilience in the face of an inexplicable disaster.

Title: The Poisonwood Bible
Author: Barbara Kingsolver
Description: A story told by the wife and four daughters of a fierce evangelical missionary who takes his family to the Belgian Congo in 1959.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Description: A father and son's bleak journey across a post-apocalyptic landscape.

Title: The Scarlet Letter
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
Description: A powerful and searing study of Puritan New England, focusing on the consequences of adultery and betrayal.

Title: The Secret History
Author: Donna Tartt
Description: A murder among a group of brilliant but eccentric students at an elite New England college.

Title: The Shadow of the Wind
Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
Description: A young boy in post-Spanish Civil War Barcelona discovers a book that leads him into a world of intrigue and betrayal.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Description: A family’s winter in an isolated hotel erupts into madness.

Title: The Silence of the Lambs
Author: Thomas Harris
Description: An FBI trainee seeks the advice of an imprisoned cannibalistic serial killer to catch another serial killer.

Title: The Sound and the Fury
Author: William Faulkner
Description: A complex tale of the decline of the Compson family in Mississippi, employing a range of narrative techniques.

Title: The Stranger
Author: Albert Camus
Description: The story of an emotionally detached man who is drawn into a senseless murder on an Algerian beach.

Title: The Sun Also Rises
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Description: A poignant exploration of the post-World War I disillusionment experienced by a group of American expatriates in Europe.

Title: The Three Musketeers
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Description: A historical adventure about the escapades of a young man named d'Artagnan after he leaves home to join the Musketeers of the Guard.

Title: The Time Traveler's Wife
Author: Audrey Niffenegger
Description: A love story about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably.

Title: The Trial
Author: Franz Kafka
Description: A nightmarish novel where a man is arrested and prosecuted by a remote authority, without ever being informed of his charges.

Title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
Author: Haruki Murakami
Description: A blend of the mundane and the surreal, as a man searches for his missing wife.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A deep dive into race and human rights in America through the eyes of Scout Finch.

Title: To the Lighthouse
Author: Virginia Woolf
Description: The story of the Ramsay family's summer holiday in Scotland, exploring themes of existential doubt and the passage of time.

Title: Ulysses
Author: James Joyce
Description: A complex narrative of a single day in the life of Leopold Bloom in Dublin.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Description: A narrative that follows the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.

Title: White Fang
Author: Jack London
Description: The story of a wild wolfdog's journey to domestication in Yukon Territory, Canada.

Title: White Teeth
Author: Zadie Smith
Description: A multi-generational tale exploring Britain's relationship with people from formerly colonized countries.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
Description: A story of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.
